{{Infobox football biography | name = Danilo Pantić | image = 20171110 AUT-SRB BSFZ Danilo Pantić 850 4078 DxO.jpg | image_size = 245px | caption = Pantić in 2017 | fullname = Danilo Pantić{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1996|10|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Ruma]], [[Serbia and Montenegro|FR Yugoslavia]] | height = 1.81 m | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[FK Partizan|Partizan]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 55 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[FK Jedinstvo Ruma|Jedinstvo Ruma]] | youthyears2 = 2007–2013 | youthclubs2 = [[FK Partizan|Partizan]] | years1 = 2013–2015 | clubs1 = [[FK Partizan|Partizan]] | caps1 = 18 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2015– | clubs2 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015–2016 | clubs3 = → [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]] (loan) | caps3 = 6 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2016–2017 | clubs4 = → [[S.B.V. Excelsior|Excelsior]] (loan) | caps4 = 9 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = → [[FK Partizan|Partizan]] (loan) | caps5 = 50 | goals5 = 8 | nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Serbia national under-17 football team|Serbia U17]]Only official [[UEFA]] matches included | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2013–2015 | nationalteam2 = [[Serbia national under-19 football team|Serbia U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 12 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalyears3 = 2017– | nationalteam3 = [[Serbia national under-21 football team|Serbia U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 11 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | pcupdate = 14 December 2018 | ntupdate = 2 June 2015 }} '''Danilo Pantić''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Данило Пантић}}, {{IPA-sh|danǐlo pǎːntitɕ|pron}}; born 26 October 1996) is a Serbian [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[FK Partizan|Partizan]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. He has represented [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] at multiple youth levels. ==Club career== ===Partizan=== Pantić made his debut on 26 May 2013 in a league fixture against [[FK Spartak Subotica|Spartak Subotica]], replacing [[Vladimir Volkov]] in the 70th minute.{{cite news | url=http://www.sr.partizan.rs/64315-64315/ | title=Partizan – Spartak ZV 5:0 (2:0) | language=Serbian | publisher=partizan.rs | date=26 May 2013 | accessdate=26 May 2013}}{{cite news | url=http://www.sr.partizan.rs/65166-nadolaze-mladi-lavovi/ | title=Nadolaze ‘mladi lavovi’ | language=Serbian | publisher=partizan.rs | date=16 June 2013 | accessdate=16 June 2013}} After a disagreement with Partizan over contract extension proposals, he signed a one-and-a-half year contract with Partizan on December 5, 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.b92.net/sport/fudbal/vesti.php?yyyy=2013&mm=12&dd=05&nav_id=785517|title=Pantić potpisao na godinu i po dana|publisher=B92|language=sr|date=5 December 2013}} [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] had scouted Pantić since early 2014, allegedly monitoring his status due to his short contract.{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/sport/1097528-pantic-ne-moze-u-juventus-pre-januara|title=Pantić ne može u Juventus pre januara!|publisher=Telegraf Sport|language=sr|date=2 June 2014}} After hearing about interest from Juventus, Pantić told ''[[Večernje novosti]]'' that he wished to extend his contract with Partizan before leaving Serbia.{{cite web|url=http://www.novosti.rs/vesti/sport.294.html:497761-Pantic-Ne-zanima-me-Juventus-hocu-u-Ligu-sampiona-s-Partizanom|title=Pantić: Ne zanima me Juventus, hoću u Ligu šampiona s Partizanom!|publisher=[[Večernje novosti]]|language=sr|date=25 June 2014}} ===Chelsea=== On 13 July 2015 Pantić signed for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for a reported fee of £1.25 million, on a four-year deal and was immediately loaned out to [[Eredivisie]] side [[Vitesse Arnhem]].{{cite web|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/pantic-the-latest-chelsea-player-to-join-vitesse/|title=Pantic the latest Chelsea player to join Vitesse|publisher=Football Oranje|date=13 July 2015|accessdate=13 July 2015}} ====Loan to Vitesse==== He made his Vitesse debut 17 days later in a [[UEFA Europa League]] third qualifying round first leg against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at [[St. Mary's Stadium|St. Mary's]], replacing [[Valeri Kazaishvili]] for the final 23 minutes of a 3–0 defeat.{{cite news|last1=Williams|first1=Adam|title=Southampton 3-0 Vitesse|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667103|accessdate=7 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 July 2015}} On 9 August 2015, Pantić made his league debut in a 1–1 draw with [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]], replacing [[Valeri Qazaishvili]] in the 71st minute.{{Cite news |title=Willem II vs. Vitesse |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/09/netherlands/eredivisie/sbv-willem-ii-tilburg/sbv-vitesse/2039258/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=9 August 2015}} On 3 March 2016, after being supposedly 'frozen' out of the Vitesse starting eleven, Pantić stated his passion for a return to London: "I want to come back to Chelsea, just to train. Why am I in Vitesse if I am not good enough? I am [going] crazy! I've made no mistake. If I had a chance and blew it, I would keep quiet. Maybe in Vitesse they don't like us [[Serbia|Serbs]]: [[Nemanja Matić]] did not get a chance here either and [[Uroš Đurđević]] played 22 matches in a year and a half."{{Cite news |title=Chelsea loanee Danilo Pantic angry with Vitesse impasse |url=http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2016/3/3/11150312/chelsea-loanee-danilo-pantic-angry-with-vitesse-impasse |publisher=David Pasztor (SB Nation) |date=3 March 2016}} Following this interview, Pantić was suspended by first-team manager [[Rob Maas]] indefinitely.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} ====Loan to Excelsior==== On 12 August 2016, Pantić joined Excelsior on loan for the 2016–17 campaign.{{cite news|url=http://sbvexcelsior.nl/excelsior-rotterdam-huurt-danilo-pantic-van-chelsea/|title=EXCELSIOR ROTTERDAM HUURT DANILO PANTIĆ VAN CHELSEA|date=12 August 2016|work=S.B.V. Excelsior}} On 17 September 2016, Pantić made his debut against [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]] off the bench coming on after half-time as Excelsior went on to score a late goal to earn a 1–1 draw.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/match?gameId=451111 |title=Willem II Tilburg 1-1 Excelsior |date=17 September 2016 |publisher=ESPN}} In the following match, on 20 September, he made his full debut, playing a full 90 minutes in a 1–0 win over [[BVV Barendrecht]] in the [[2016–17 KNVB Cup|KNVB Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/match?gameId=466501 |title=Barendrecht 0-1 Excelsior |date=20 September 2016 |publisher=ESPN}} ====Loan to Partizan==== On 18 June 2017, Pantić returned to his boyhood club, [[FK Partizan|Partizan]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=Danilo Pantic back in Partizan! |url=http://www.en.partizan.rs/59473-danilo-pantic-back-in-partizan/ |publisher=FK Partizan |date=18 June 2017 |accessdate=20 June 2017}} On 22 July 2017, Pantić scored a goal against [[FK Mačva Šabac|Mačva Šabac]] in first fixture of the [[2017–18 Serbian SuperLiga]] season in a 6–1 home league win.{{cite news|title=Partizan 'šesticom' najavio dolazak Olimpijakosa|url=http://www.b92.net/sport/fudbal/vesti.php?yyyy=2017&mm=07&dd=22&nav_id=1285505|accessdate=24 July 2017|work=[[B92]]|date=22 July 2017|language=Serbian}} On 5 November, Pantić entered in a game as a substitute for [[Marko Janković (footballer, born 1995)|Marko Janković]] in the 72nd minute and with two assists help club to reach a 3–1 away victory over Mačva.{{Cite web | url=https://sport.blic.rs/fudbal/domaci-fudbal/presuda-sa-bele-tacke-partizan-uz-preokret-odneo-ceo-plen-iz-sapca-video/443de3b | title=PRESUDA SA BELE TAČKE Partizan uz preokret odneo ceo plen iz Šapca | language=Serbian | publisher=blic.rs | date=5 November 2017 | accessdate=12 May 2018}} That match is a big turn for Pantić, because after that match he played in first eleven almost every match until the end of the season. On 23 November 2017, he start in a five match of [[2017–18 UEFA Europa League group stage]], against [[BSC Young Boys|Young Boys]], he made one assist and was one of the best Partizan players on that match, where Partizan advanced to the knockout stage after 13 years.{{Cite web | url=http://www.sportskacentrala.com/2017/11/23/partizan-zimuje-u-evropi-video/ | title=Partizan zimuje u Evropi! [VIDEO+FOTO] | language=Serbian | publisher=sportskacentrala.com | date=23 November 2017 | accessdate=26 November 2017}} In second part of the season, Pantić scored a couple a very nice goals and had a couple assist. Due to his consistent performances throughout the season, Pantić was named in the [[Serbian SuperLiga Team of the Season#2017–18|league's best eleven]].{{cite web |url=http://www.superliga.rs/vesti/812-super-liga-odrzana-manifestacija-prvi-tim-priznanja-u-rukama-najboljih|title=Super liga: Održana manifestacija ''Prvi tim'', priznanja u rukama najboljih|website=Serbian SuperLiga official website|language=Serbian|date=14 May 2018|accessdate=16 May 2018}} On 5 July 2018, Pantić's loan at his boyhood club was extended for a further season.{{Cite news|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/7/5/pantic-in-serbian-loan|title=Pantic in Serbian loan {{!}} Official Site {{!}} Chelsea Football Club|work=ChelseaFC|access-date=2018-07-05}} ==International career== ===Youth=== Pantić has represented Serbia at the [[Serbia national under-17 football team|U17]] and [[Serbia national under-19 football team|U19]] levels.{{citation|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2014/teams/player=250055213/index.html|title=UEFA u-19 team|publisher=UEFA}} On 10 October 2014, Pantić scored his first and second goal for the U19 side in the opening twenty minutes against [[San Marino national under-19 football team|San Marino U19]] to help Serbia to a 4–0 victory in their opening match of the [[2015 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification|2015 UEFA Euro U19 Championship Qualifiers]].{{citation|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2015/matches/round=2000537/match=2013531/index.html|title=Serbia U19 4-0 San Marino U19|date=10 October 2014}} Pantić has captained at the U19 level, captaining for the first time on 12 October 2014, against [[Armenia national under-19 football team|Armenia U19]] in a [[2015 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification|UEFA Euro U19 Championship Qualifier]] match, which ended in a 1–0 victory for the Serbian side. ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 22 July 2018.{{Soccerway|danilo-panti/270001}}}} {|
